content: Think of his wife? Everything she said was true, but it still shouldn’t have been said? Democrats aren’t treating Sessions with sufficient respect because they’re still butthurt over the election? Seriously? I’m surprised that Senator Hatch needs to have it explained to him how the confirmation process works. Here goes — the President appoints someone to be his Attorney General. The appointment goes to the Senate for confirmation. The Senate discusses the qualifications of the appointee and his fitness for the position. This means anything relevant may be brought up, both positive and negative. And no appointee gets special treatment just because he happens to be a sitting Senator.
